title: BFV-Type Representation of Path-Integral for Dynamical System with second class constraints
abstract: It is shown that the phase space of a dynamical system subject to second class constraints can be extended by ghost variables in such a way that some formal analogies of the $\Omega$-charge and the unitarizing Hamiltonian can be constructed. Then BFV-type path integral representation for the generating functional of Green's functions is written and shown to coincide with the standard one.
